channel.title: Help getting RSCA online
channel.description: Decided to use Mopar's source instead. /closed

item.title: Help getting RSCA online
item.dc:creator: @latifundio latifundio
item.description:
@latifundio wrote:

[quote=“P_E_A_C_E, post:1, topic:416019”]The guide shows how to get it running offline. What do I change to get it running online? Or do I have the wrong thread link. If so, will you please link me to the correct one? Thanks. :)[/quote]Check out your ip here http://www.ip-address.org/ then go into your client source folder (src/org/rscdaemon/client/util) and open “Config.java” you will see this:

[code]public class Config {

public static String SERVER_IP = "localhost", CONF_DIR =  System.getProperty("user.home") + File.separator + ".moparscape" + File.separator + "devCache", MEDIA_DIR = CONF_DIR;

public static int SERVER_PORT = 43595, MOVIE_FPS = 5;[/code]

Where it says localhost change it for your ip.
Also you could check that your server port is open if u got a firewall.

Read full topic

item.title: Help getting RSCA online
item.dc:creator: @IlikeArrays IlikeArrays
item.description:
@IlikeArrays wrote:

just edit the login server config and gameserver config… login server will be localhost and gameserver would be your default gateway ip or something like that (192.168…)
